data.title: Purdue names next president to replace Mitch Daniels
meta_keywords: Federal Government Of The United States
data.meta_description: Mitch Daniels is ready to step down as President at Purdue. He announced today he will leave at the end of the year. Daniels has been in the position since January of 2013. Before that he was Governor of Indiana. He has led the university through the pandemic... and 11 straight years of no tuition increases. Purdue Polytechnic High Schools also started under his leadership... including the one in South Bend. On Friday Purdue University named Dr. Mung Chiang as the university’s next president.
data.text:
Mitch Daniels is ready to step down as President at Purdue. He announced today he will leave at the end of the year.

Daniels has been in the position since January of 2013.

Before that he was Governor of Indiana.

He has led the university through the pandemic... and 11 straight years of no tuition increases.

Purdue Polytechnic High Schools also started under his leadership... including the one in South Bend.

On Friday Purdue University named Dr. Mung Chiang as the university’s next president. He will replace Mitch Daniels effective on January 1, 2023.

The board unanimously approved his election.

Currently, Chiang is the John A Edwardson Dean of Engineering and Executive Vice President of Strategic Initiatives.

“It is the highest and most humbling honor to be selected by the Board of Trustees as the next president of Purdue University: the unique and most remarkable land-grant university in the land of the free. Throughout the past 153 years, and spanning from the Wabash River to the moon, generations of Boilermakers contributed to our state, to our country, and to humanity in immeasurable ways. There is no other place like Purdue." said Dr. Mung Chiang.

You can read the full release .
